intro: Cyrtandra sericifolia, commonly known as the silky cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cyrtandra sericifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
